captions.caption: A woman drives a car down a dark road at night.

Three men are sitting at a table in a dimly lit room with a bar and shelves of alcohol behind them. One man tells a joke that causes all three men to laugh, then asks, "Those boys should have been back by now, wonder if something might have gone wrong?"

The woman replies that she knows the place, then shoots the man in the pool.
The woman says that is a present for her sister and for a cop named Carter.

timecodes.caption: Carrie and her boyfriend, John Tate, are in a hallway with a gun, ready to defend themselves. A figure is seen in a doorway down the hall.

John refuses to leave Carrie and pulls her back.

John collapses to the ground. Carrie holds her gun out in Michael’s direction.

John is dead on the floor.
Carrie watches in horror as Michael comes toward John’s body.
Michael stabs John’s body while Carrie watches and cries.
Carrie runs down the hallway.
Michael pursues Carrie.
Carrie runs into a storage room and yells to a woman to lock the door.
Michael closes in on the door as it closes.
He breaks down the door.
Carrie hits Michael with a fire extinguisher and runs out of the storage room.
She bangs on a door and pleads for someone to open it.
Michael watches from the hallway as someone opens the door to let Carrie in.

timecodes.caption: Juni is presented with the Game Over video game by Ms. Gradenko

Juni is prepped to enter the game.
Juni is warned to not release Toymaker from cyberspace and is given the game playing glasses.

A Standard Heating Oil Co. truck is parked between a police car and a silver car.
Abel Morales, the owner of Standard, asks the two men why they're there, and what they've done. One of the men apologizes and says he's not sure what they did.
The police officer tells Abel that he just arrived and his shift is over.
Abel climbs on top of the oil truck.
The police officer asks why the men wanted the oil, and Abel explains they wanted the $6,000 worth of fuel that was inside.
The officer gets in his car, and Abel walks on the top of the truck.
J.C. Chandor, the writer and director, talks about his goal for the visual aspects of this film.
Oscar Isaac, who plays Abel Morales, says they were lucky to have Bradford Young as the cinematographer.
Bradford Young says it felt like he was with kindred spirits.
J.C. Chandor says their working relationship is great for both of them.
Oscar Isaac says Bradford is a brilliant alchemist with light.
Neal Dodson, the producer, says Bradford is talented and passionate about the project.
Bradford says he knew the film would be widescreen.
J.C. Chandor says he wanted the film to have a broader scope.
A montage of black and white pictures of New York City from the 1980's plays, and Bradford Young talks about the challenges of capturing the city and the decay from that period.

set_timecodes.caption: Ming the Merciless walks out to address his people.

video_caption_data.caption: A man is standing in a room, speaking to someone off-screen.
He is explaining that someone offered him a job, but he declined.
He is now at a desk talking to someone seated on the other side of it. He’s talking about his guitar.
Now he’s recounting the events of the night before the party.
He says he needs to find someone to get his guitar out of hock.
Charlie Five offered him a job at the Starlight Lounge.
Charlie offered him money to participate in a party at the Club Rendezvous. This was the party that was raided.
He says he started a disturbance at the party because he was upset about the offer and something about his whole life being sick on his stomach.
He’s being asked how soon he’ll be back at the place.

captions.caption: A man asks to close the theater after discovering that a woman is onstage.
An angry nobleman is offended by graffiti on the wall of the theater. He demands it be removed.
Mr. Tilney questions this outburst. The nobleman explains that he views the theatrical presentation as “treason and indecency.”
A young boy tells the nobleman he's looking for a woman, and points to her.
Two men in the audience look toward the stage where the woman stands with a man.
The woman in the red dress has a male appearance.
The nobleman approaches the stage, again claiming to see a woman, but referring to the male actor in female attire.
The nobleman angrily declares the theater closed due to the presentation of a woman on the stage.
The other men ask why the theater is being closed.
The nobleman explains that he considers the presence of a female actress “rudeness and unshamefacedness.”
The nobleman makes a final announcement of the closure of the theater as he leaves, still assuming the actress is a woman.
The male actor portraying the female character on the stage removes his wig and facial hair.
The young boy who pointed out the male actor expresses delight. He knew that the “woman” was actually a man.
The other male actor asks if no one knew that the female character was played by a male. The young boy tells them that he knew.
Mr. Tilney is surprised that the character was indeed a woman. The nobleman confirms this.
Mr. Tilney asks who would have done such a thing. The nobleman suggests that William Shakespeare was involved.
The actress tells them no one knew.
The young boy tells them he knew because he saw William Shakespeare kissing the actress’s breasts.
Mr. Tilney declares that everything is over.
The actress apologizes.
Mr. Tilney asks if everything is alright.
Mr. Tilney tells the actress that she was wonderful onstage.
Mr. Tilney suggests that Shakespeare pay the actress for her performance.
Shakespeare hands the actress money.
A noblewoman prepares food in her private chambers.
Two men stand on a platform in a dark, theater-like room, each holding a dark oblong-shaped device to their ear.
Two men stand on a platform in a dark room, holding devices to their ears while a Klingon in dark clothing stands next to them.
The two men on the platform look towards the shadowy figure of a judge sitting in the room above them.
The woman is sitting and wearing dark clothing and makeup.
A man is holding a dark oblong-shaped device to his ear.
A man with short dark hair sits in a captain's chair.
Two men stand on a platform in a dark, theater-like room, each holding a dark oblong-shaped device to their ear.
An older man sits in a captain's chair while a blonde woman sits on a nearby stool.
The judge is seen from below holding what appears to be a crystal ball.
Two men on the platform hold their listening devices while looking up at the judge.
The man with short gray hair sits with his eyes closed.
The blonde woman faces forward while looking up slightly.
An older black man faces forward with his eyes slightly closed.
The woman sits, looking ahead.
The men on the platform hold their listening devices while looking towards their lawyer, who is below them.
A group of young men in period clothing are robbed by a man on horseback.
One of the young men aims a pistol at the man on horseback.
The man on horseback scolds his associates.
The man on horseback calls Jackson a fool and insults him.
One of the associates suggests shooting the man on horseback.
Another associate agrees, encouraging the young man to shoot.
The man on horseback gives the young man some advice.
The man on horseback fires his gun.
The man on horseback tells the boys to gather his belongings.
The boys gather the man's belongings.
One of the associates scolds another.
The associate hits the other associate.
The man on horseback gives a man his money.
The man on horseback wishes he could kill the person that told him to go West.
The man on horseback points out the lunch and questions if the boys have a chef.
The man tells the boys to take the lunch.
One of the associates tries to take a can from the lunch but the others stop him.
The man on horseback says goodbye to the boys and rides away.

Scene of New York City with taxi cabs and a woman walking.

Man and woman on the beach walking towards each other.

Man on surfboard.

Movie credits appear on a black background.
A man spots an enemy ship through his periscope.
Crew members scramble to fulfill an order from the man on the periscope to start the diesel.
One man with a flashlight guides his teammates toward the diesel engine.
The man goes back to his periscope.
The crew members begin firing the diesel engine up.
The U-boat surfaces in the water.
A German ship fires its guns and the scene cuts back to inside the U-boat.
Water begins rushing into the U-boat due to the attack from the German ship.
The U-boat's periscope shows the German ship getting closer.
The U-boat gets rocked by another attack from the German ship.
One crew member attempts to close a hatch.
Water floods into the submarine through the hatch.
The German ship fires its guns again and hits the U-boat.
More water floods the submarine.
The German ship fires more shots at the U-boat.
The man from the U-boat periscope gives an order.
The U-boat fires a missile and hits the German ship.
Water explodes into the U-boat from the other side.
The U-boat fires another missile towards the German ship.
More water blasts into the submarine.
The man at the periscope gives a new order.
A crew member begins pulling a lever.
The U-boat launches another missile from underwater.
The submarine commander watches through his periscope.
German sailors observe something in the water.
A man on the ship's bridge turns the wheel.
The missile launched by the U-boat hits the German ship.
The man on the submarine's periscope observes the explosions and fires another missile.
A teacher states that Tony Whitney has brought something very special for show and tell.
A child pushes a wagon carrying a sea lion through the classroom, and the teacher and children react with surprise.
The child, Toni Whitney, introduces the sea lion as the newest member of her family and tells the other children the animal’s name and favorite color.
Toni’s classmates are skeptical of the new member of the family, and the sea lion barks and claps his flippers, seemingly trying to make friends.
The video transitions to a fishing harbor.
Fishermen discuss how they’ve been dealing with a sea lion that has been taking and eating some of their fish.
Toni's father is questioned about Toni keeping the sea lion for a pet.
Toni cries in bed because she is being forced to release her sea lion back into the wild.
A man opens his accordion case and removes his accordion.
The man places his accordion on the bed and makes his way to the sliding door.
The man sits on the bed and plays his accordion.
The man puts his accordion back in the case and leaves the room.
A woman sits alone in a jacuzzi. The motel parking lot is wet from the rain.
The man appears from inside of the motel, removes his clothes, and gets into the jacuzzi.
The man and woman talk in the jacuzzi.
Wide shot of the jacuzzi and the motel.

set_timecodes.caption: Two men are arm-wrestling in prison, surrounded by a crowd of inmates.
The first man wins the first round. He drinks some liquid given by his handlers.
The second round of arm-wrestling begins.
The second man wins the round, and the first man is consoled by his handlers.
The second man is tended to by his handlers after round two, while two prison guards are watching from a surveillance room.
The third round starts. The first man is quickly overwhelmed, and he drinks again before restarting.
The first man has a new confidence and tells the second man he’s up for assault and battery.
The first man easily wins the third round.
The fourth round begins.
The second man wins the fourth round again. The first man is attended to before round five.
The fifth round begins. The second man gains the upper hand when the first man lets go of his hand and ends up headbutting the table in frustration.
The second man wins the match. A view of the prison is shown.
A listing of related movie clips appears.
A listing of featured clips by actor appears, with Vinnie Jones featured first.
A listing of featured clips by genre appears.
A listing of featured clips by mood appears.
A listing of other Movie Clips features appears.
The MovieClips logo is shown.

captions.caption: A dark and rainy night scene in a city, a car parked on the side of the street.
Inside the car, a man with glasses passes a folder to someone in the passenger seat.
A building with columns, a statue of Lenin, and a crowd walking around it.
Title card reads "Moscow, 1981." A car drives across a bridge, with St. Basil's Cathedral in the background.
A man is in a room with filing cabinets, looking for a file. He takes the file to a man sitting at a desk.
A man talks to a group of people sitting around a table in the Oval Office.
A man looks out a window, the American flag visible.
A quote from Ronald Reagan is shown: "One of the most important espionage cases of the 20th century."
A man runs past a large statue.
A group of people walks down a hallway.
Title card reads "A Country Ruled by Oppression." The man from the car is driving again.
The man gives some files to a person in the passenger seat. He watches the person leave the car.
The man and his wife watch a play or performance with their son.
Two men in uniform walk down some steps.
The man walks through a subway station. A guard stands by the turnstile. The man gets onto a subway car.
Title card reads "An Ordinary Man." The man meets with another man on a bench. A title card reads "An Extraordinary Opportunity." The man presses his head against the driver's side window of a car.
Title card reads "Based on the Astonishing True Story." The man's car drives down the street.
The man and his wife look at papers in the car. They look at more papers in their living room.
The man hides something under the covers of a bed. He takes photos of papers under a table draped with a tablecloth.
The wife looks distressed as she talks to the man.
Film festival awards are shown on-screen.
The man tells another man in his car that he's through, that it's become too much for him. In the winter, the man speaks to a man in uniform, who appears to be his contact.
A quote by Stephen Holden from The New York Times is shown: "A fantastic true story."
A man in a suit tells someone that they owe a debt.
The man walks through a subway tunnel, then drives a car.
A quote from Andrew O'Hehir from Salon is shown: "A fascinating piece of true-life Cold War espionage."
The man who gave files walks down a file room hallway. He puts his hand in someone's pocket.
The man looks in a mirror, and his wife looks at him.
A car drives down a snow-covered road.
A man and woman in an unknown location, wearing what appear to be standard-issue clothes.
Title card reads "Some Secrets Have the Power." A man and woman walk through a snowy landscape.
Two children sit in the back of a car. Title card reads "To Destroy Lives."
A man is wheeled down a green-lit hallway in a chair. He is wounded. A man walks down the same hallway.
Title card reads "And Change the Course of History." A man says "This operation doesn't stand a chance. No chance at all." The man from earlier embraces someone.
A critic quote reads "One of the best political thrillers in years." A man watches a woman and boy through a doorway.
A picture of Notre Dame Cathedral is placed on a shelf next to other pictures. A man tells two others in the green-lit hallway that they won't get away.
A car drives through the night. A quote by Anne Billson from The Arts Desk is shown: "Farewell is destined to be this year's The Lives of Others."
Two men in uniform look into a guard booth. A checkpoint on a snowy road is shown. Vehicles in military colours are going in the opposite direction.
The family walks through a hallway with other people. The man who gave the files stands on the snow.
Title card reads "Farewell. A film by Christian Carion." A snowy forest is shown.
The names of the main actors are shown: Guillaume Canet, Emir Kusturica, Fred Ward, and Willem Dafoe.
Two hands press against the bars of a vent.
The MovieClips menu shows related trailers, actors, genres, props, moods, and themes.
A robot swings back and forth, and then the camera zooms in on another robot on the ground.
A robot jumps onto a gear.
A robot flies through the air, lands on a vehicle, and rides off.
Another robot flies out of the vehicle, and they combine to create a warrior robot.
Other robots come out from behind the feet of the warrior robot.
A smaller robot spins around, and then a group of robots face them.
The camera zooms in on some gears as the robots face each other.
The smaller robot begins to float as more robots appear in the background.
A circular door opens and a yellow robot holding a drill emerges, and then she poses.
The small group of robots looks at the yellow robot who is standing on the raised platform.
The other robots in the background cheer for the yellow robot, and everyone prepares to fight the smaller robot.
The robots run and attack the smaller robot as it floats.
End screen with options to view more related content.
Two men in a struggle crash through glass in an office building.
A SWAT team member shoots a hostage-taker through a broken window.
Two SWAT members take aim at the hostage-taker from a rooftop.
A SWAT sniper sights through a rifle scope, centered on the hostage taker and hostage.
Two members of the SWAT team confirm visual acquisition.
The SWAT team and command center order the hostage taker to drop his weapon.
The SWAT sniper readies to fire but is hesitant.
Another SWAT member pleads with the hostage taker to drop the gun, trying to prevent the sniper from firing.
The hostage taker doesn't comply, prompting further commands to drop the weapon.
The hostage taker is repeatedly ordered to lower his weapon, but he ignores them.
A SWAT command member authorizes the sniper to eliminate the hostage taker.
One of the SWAT team expresses disbelief, prompting the command center to order the sniper to take down the hostage taker.
The command center reiterates the order to take down the hostage taker.
A SWAT sniper acknowledges the command but expresses reluctance.
A command officer demands the sniper to follow the order.
The command center relays the acknowledgment but emphasizes the criticality of the situation.
The sniper explains he can't take the shot because he doesn't have a clear line of sight.
Frustrated, the command officer insists on neutralizing the hostage taker.
The sniper maintains his position, asserting that he cannot take the shot.
The hostage situation unfolds, with the command center trying to find a solution.
The command center relieves the hesitant sniper of duty.
On the rooftop, two SWAT members react to the situation.
The movie clip platform showcases related clips and content.
The MovieClips logo appears on a black screen.
People are seated at long tables inside of an assembly hall. They are clapping and cheering.
A woman is speaking to the people in the assembly hall from a raised section. She asks for their attention.
People seated at the tables begin clapping and cheering again.
Schultze walks from behind the table to the raised section, while receiving claps from the crowd.
Schultze stands at the microphone with an accordion. He bows to the crowd and begins playing his music.
Schultze plays the accordion while facing the crowd.
Closeup of Schultze, who is concentrating on playing the accordion.
Schultze stops playing the accordion, bows to the crowd again, and the crowd applauds.
The crowd is shown a wide shot, continuing to clap.
A man and a woman drink and discuss the music.
More people begin to drink in the hall.
Website for MovieClips shows the title card for Schultze Gets the Blues.
Popular actors and directors are displayed below the movie title card.
Genre, best of, and action is shown on MovieClips.com
Prop, character type, and setting are shown on MovieClips.com
Mashups, games, and shows are featured on MovieClips.com.

set_timecodes.caption: A man carefully sets up a booby-trapped suitcase on the steps of a church at 220.
A maroon car pulls up outside the church. Several men pile out of a dark van nearby.
Two of the men speak with the driver of the maroon car, Mikhail.
The men get back into their vehicles and drive off.
The man picks up the booby-trapped suitcase and walks away down the street.
Parishioners sing hymns in the church.
The man sets the suitcase down on the steps of another building.
He carefully unravels a cord attached to the suitcase and pulls it down the street.
The cord is wrapped around the bumper of Mikhail's car. He hands a detonator to a man in the van.
A priest stands at the pulpit and recites verses from the Bible.
The man sets off the detonator from inside the van. Mikhail's car explodes.
The man who set up the booby trap retrieves his suitcase from the rooftop.
MovieClips intro.
Five Fandango Movieclips core correspondents sit on a couch.
Fans are camping on the lawn outside of the Comic-Con convention center.
Aerial view of the Comic-Con convention center.
Josh Brolin holds up the Infinity Gauntlet.
Trailer for “Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 2”.
Snoopy flies through the air with goggles and a red scarf.
Title card for “Con Man”.
People walking through the Comic-Con convention center.
Person in a cosplay costume.
Two people in cosplay costumes.
Two people in cosplay costumes.
Person in a cosplay costume.
Person in a cosplay costume.
Two people in cosplay costumes.
Person in a cosplay costume.
Person in a cosplay costume.
Follow @Fandango and @Movieclips.
The core correspondents wave goodbye.
Fandango Movieclips call to action.
Fandango Movieclips outro.

captions.description: A man and a woman in formal wear have a disagreement on a balcony with ornamental drapes and a railing.
The man gets down on one knee by a lit lamp. The woman turns away from him and walks toward the railing, looking out at the city.
An aerial shot shows the couple on the balcony, which is on top of a large, decorative elephant. The woman turns and joins the man at the railing.
The man pulls the woman close and kisses her briefly. She looks at him before exiting the balcony area.
The man stands up, seemingly floating. He balances on an ornament while the woman returns. They rise to the top of the elephant as it floats through the air.
The woman and man return to the balcony. She leans in close to his face while holding his head. He gestures with his arms while raising his head to the sky.
The Fandango intro card appears, showing the movie poster and four scenes from the movie, along with other promotional options.
The video lists Miranda Otto and Yaphet Kotto as actors and Baz Luhrmann as the director.
The video tags the movie scene with "Seduce" for action, "Romance" for theme, and "Period Pieces" for genre. The tags briefly appear with scenes from other movies.

captions.caption: A woman with cropped, long-sleeved top and jeans walks into the room from a doorway on the right side of the screen. Two children walk in behind her, the boy on the left in a t-shirt and jeans and the girl on the right in a long-sleeved nightgown. The woman crouches on a rug in the center of the room. The room also has a vanity on the left of the screen with a chair and lamp, and a wall lamp on the right side of the screen near the doorways.
Close-up shot of the boy’s face as he looks on, with the louvered door on the left side of the screen, the wall lamp is still to his right, and wallpaper behind him.
The camera angle changes to focus on the girl standing in the right doorway. The wall lamp is to her left. She speaks to the woman crouching on the rug, whose back is turned toward the camera.
The woman speaks back to the girl, and the camera angle shows her from the waist up, facing the girl with the vanity in the background.
The girl responds to the woman, and the camera angle shows her close up with the right doorway to the left of her face.
The girl picks up a red rectangle from a nightstand.
Close-up shot of the boy’s face.
The woman speaks to the boy, with the vanity in the background. She is looking in his direction.
Close-up shot of the boy’s face.
The woman speaks to the boy and turns to look up behind her in the direction of the vanity.
Close-up shot of the boy’s face.
The woman speaks and gestures with her hands. The camera angle shows the three of them standing next to the louvered door.
Close-up shot of the girl’s face, now standing near the louvered door with the woman.
The camera angle shows the woman and girl standing near the louvered door, and then a black and pink teddy bear on the rug.
The girl, now sitting on a bed near the right doorway, speaks to the woman, who is partially visible in the louvered door.
The boy pushes on the louvered door, which the woman is pulling on from the other side. She has been locked in.
Close-up shot of the woman’s face, looking up at the door.
The woman looks at the door and speaks to the children, who are now locking the louvered door.
The camera angle shows the girl sitting on the bed through the louvered door.
Close-up of the door knob on the louvered door as the boys lock the door.
The woman has been locked inside and tries to get out. The lights go out and the girl is shown briefly holding the red rectangle in the shadows on the bed.
The woman shouts to the boys to let her out.
The lights go out. The woman screams from inside the closet and continues to shout for the boys to open the door.
The girl is shown from a higher vantage point, and she is sitting on the bed, still holding the red rectangle.
The woman speaks from inside the closet, and then the girl is shown sitting on the bed looking at the red rectangle, which is facing away from the camera.
The boy pulls at the doorknob, the lights flicker on and off, and the woman screams. She is then shown saying something to someone.
Another girl appears in the closet with the woman.
The girl in the closet points at a dark mark on her forehead while speaking, then she turns and shows the woman a deeper, red mark on her forehead.
A scream is heard. The woman yells and reaches her hand out toward the girl.
The woman is screaming as the girl grabs her hand.
Close-up of the girl’s face, with a red mark on her forehead, as she holds the woman’s hand. The lights flicker on and off.
The woman screams as she falls back.
Close-up shot of the girl’s face, with blood coming from the mark on her forehead.
The woman screams from inside the closet.

The boys open the door and look around. One yells for help. The woman is heard screaming and then she is flung against the louvered door from inside the closet, which has been shown from the outside and now from inside.
The lights flick on and off, the scene shows the wall lamp and then shows a doll with a bloody face.
Close-up shot of the louvered door from inside as it breaks open.
The woman screams and presses bloody hands against the door. She screams and yells for help.
The scene moves to an ambulance with a flashing red light on the side. Someone opens the back door, and the scene shows the woman on a stretcher with the little girl looking on.
The woman sits up and speaks to the girl, and the camera angle pans down slightly to show the girl by the woman’s side. The paramedics lower the stretcher to wheel it away.
The screen changes to show a website with still images from the movie and related videos, and includes search fields for filtering by actors and themes.

set_timecodes.caption: Two girls and a woman in gingham clothes are inside. The woman holds a red gasoline can and tells the girls they are going to do the flaming baton trick later.
Two more girls are inside, playing.
A blonde boy runs around yelling, "sissy". The girls playing chase him out the door.
The girls and the man wearing a Hawaiian shirt discuss the chase.
The girls continue their chase.
The man says, "Alright."
The chase continues outside a white church.
The man picks up the blonde boy and threatens him regarding the girls.
The man releases the boy, who runs off.
The man lectures one of the girls about fighting.
The man offers a cigarette to the girl.

captions.caption: A man is talking to a boy while smoking a cigarette. He is in a boxing ring inside a gym, and the boy is wearing boxing headgear.
The man places boxing gloves on the boy's hands. The boy puts up his dukes.
Another man comes into view and complains about the training. The trainer tells him to help the kid defend himself.

The two men have a brief conversation about the boy. The trainer then asks the second man what he would do if someone tried to pull up his underwear, and the man doesn't know. The trainer tells him to get angry, to yell, and to try to make the kid mad.
The second man punches the boy and is then punched by the boy. He fell on the floor.
The trainer tells the second man that the boy is a “fucking faggot”, which upsets him and then knocks the boy onto the floor.
The trainer tells the second man to get louder and make the boy angry. The boy yells, and then knocks the second man on the floor.
The trainer asks the second man what’s wrong with him since the boy is “just a kid”.
The second man complains about the trainer making him “ouch”. Then the boy knocks the second man to the floor.
The trainer tells the boy he shouldn't spend so much time with him. The second man curses at the trainer and the boy.
The Movieclips website is displayed along with a grid of clips from “Bad Santa”, the actor names, director name, genre, and setting of this clip. The website also offers mashups, games, and shows.
Groucho greets Zeppo.
Groucho begins an argument with Zeppo.
Groucho tells Zeppo about his time in college and his dating experiences.
Groucho tells Zeppo to leave.
Groucho instructs Zeppo on how to leave a schoolroom.
Zeppo suggests getting a new college president, like himself.
Groucho tells Zeppo the college needs a good football team.
Groucho agrees Zeppo has something there and asks what happens next.
Zeppo suggests recruiting football players in a speakeasy.
Groucho asks Zeppo about having a nip, and Zeppo says he'll wait for Groucho at the speakeasy.
Zeppo asks more questions.
Groucho expresses his disappointment in Zeppo and begins to leave.
More Marx Brothers videos.
Clips featuring Groucho Marx and Zeppo Marx.
More clips with the genre Classic, theme Insults/Comebacks, and singing clips.
More clips with the theme Family, clips with a son, and clips set in college.
Mashups, Games, and Shows from movieclips.com.
A young boy taunts two men on the street and leads them on a chase over the wall.
The men have the boy cornered.
Another boy runs up and speaks to the cornered boy.
The boys converse.
The cornered boy sends the other boy away.
The other boy runs back to the men.
The boy tells the men to let the cornered boy go. He’s getting on the bus, and he asks the men to help him with his bag.
The boy gets onto the bus, and the two men look on.
The cornered boy watches as the other boy on the bus talks to the man in the coat.
The bus doors close, and the boy and the man have a moment of laughter through the window.
The man in the coat walks away.
The bus pulls off.
The man in the coat stands in the middle of the parking area and watches the bus leave.

Bruce Willis fires a machine gun while moving around a room.

Bruce Willis and Jai Courtney in the same scene.
Bruce Willis is standing near a car and talking to people around him.

Bruce Willis is talking in a scene.

Yuliya Snigir is in a scene with Jai Courtney.
Director, John Moore, is shown from his chest up.
Yuliya Snigir stands in front of the camera.

Four men are looking at something. One of them is gesturing to something in front of him.

Bruce Willis is in a dimly lit room. Someone is holding a pen and highlighting something in a story board, next to him.

timecodes.caption: The green screen shows an MPAA approval of the preview for Robot & Frank, a PG-13-rated movie.
The Stage 6 company logo appears.
An older man struggles with his mobility scooter on a road surrounded by trees.
The title card displays "SOMETIME IN THE NEAR FUTURE..."

captions.caption: A computer screen displays information about three people, Jane Owen, Stephen Keller, and Thomas Cruz.
A blonde woman wearing a black dress looks at a computer screen that displays a file of Jane Owen. Another woman sits on a chair in front of the blonde woman, who asks her who she would choose.
The woman on the chair responds with "Me." The blonde woman asks her why, and the woman sitting explains that she is unexpected.

The sitting woman continues, saying that being unexpected is the only advantage that matters. The blonde woman counters her argument by saying that she chose Tom. The seated woman says it's because Tom is the last interview.

The blonde woman moves her chair closer to the seated woman and tells her that she reminds her of herself at the same age. She says that the seated woman is smart enough that it might be a disadvantage.
The blonde woman says that the seated woman hasn't failed at anything yet. The seated woman says that she has been researching exclusively in her field for nine months.

The blonde woman asks the seated woman if she had a goldfish as a kid. The seated woman responds, "Sure." The blonde woman continues, asking if she remembers taking it home and letting the water in a little bit at a time so that the fish could adjust.
The blonde woman tells the seated woman not to follow her ego out of the bag early. The blonde woman picks up a gift on her desk and hands it to the seated woman.
The seated woman unwraps the gift; it is a pair of Birkenstock sandals. The blonde woman explains that you put your first choice in the middle because to put it last is expected.
The screen displays three videos: Now You See Me Clip - Thaddeus Teleports Dylan; G.I. Joe: Retaliation TV SPOT - Video Games; and The East TRAILER (2013).
The screen displays Ellen Page, Julia Ormond, and Ridley Scott, each with a respective video.

A woman asks the man, "George," how he would define money.  George replies that he means big money like hundreds of thousands of dollars. The woman says George doesn't feel well and wonders if he's sure that pain is in his stomach, to which George replies that he is going to have hundreds of thousands of dollars and maybe even half a million. The woman laughs and says that he is a darling and hopes that he addressed his letter to the North Pole correctly. George tells her to wait and see, and that maybe she won't be laughing so hard in a few days.

The woman asks George if he really is serious and really thinks he's going to have a lot of money. George hands her a glass of water and says that he doesn't think anything, he knows it. The woman takes a sip of water and says that George has never been a liar and he doesn't have enough imagination to lie. She asks what makes him think or know that he is going to have several hundred thousand dollars, to which George replies that he does but just can't talk about it.

The woman asks why George can't talk about it with her, especially when he calls her his little Sherry. George says that he shouldn't have even mentioned that he is going to have the money, and it's not that he minds but knows that he can trust her, but worries that the other guys… The woman interrupts, asking other guys? George says he can't talk about it and asks if that's why he's going out tonight, to which George replies that it has nothing to do with that, he just has to go uptown for a little while.

The woman says she sees, and if that's how he wants to act, she won't stop him. George pleads with her, saying not to be sore at him. The woman begins to put on lipstick in the mirror as she says that when a woman has been married for five years and her own husband doesn't trust her, why should she think more of him than he does her? George asks what right she has to say a thing like that as he knows that he's crazy about her and that she is the only thing in the world for him. He continues, saying that he is doing this for her and if he didn't love her so much… The woman grabs his hand and says that she doesn't want him to do anything for her, that she doesn't want to talk to him anymore, and he can go up and see his friends or whoever he wants to.

The woman tells George that he shouldn't be surprised if she isn't there when he gets home. George says that she better be there, and hopes that she wouldn't do anything foolish. The woman says she certainly wouldn't want to, but as long as he doesn't trust her or have the slightest bit of faith in her… George says that if he ever found her with another man… The woman interrupts, asking why, as he has no use for her. She adds that he says he does, but when it comes to proving it, he says one thing and does the opposite. The woman asks George for a cigarette, which he gives to her, and she lights it.
George tells Sherry that he can tell her a little bit about it, most of it, as he has her promise.

set_timecodes.caption: A woman sits at a bar with a newspaper and a glass of red wine while a man tends bar.
A man plays piano while the woman walks away from the bar to watch him. She returns to her drink with the man playing.
The man sits at the bar next to the woman and drinks from a clear glass of liquor. They are now facing each other.

The woman asks if he’s drunk while he holds his drink. He responds and says something about both of them looking beautiful. The woman asks why he looks so sad. He claims it’s because of his job requirements for his current employment as a happy piano player in the circus.

The woman makes a sarcastic remark about happy piano players and nightclubs, and he suggests only until baseball season starts. She reminds him that season starts in a few months. He asks her to go home with him, and she says no.
He tells her he has to ask and admits he isn't attracted to her. She asks him to play something else.

She claims that she can’t dance to what he’s playing. He sighs, then says that she’d be surprised. He states that she's spurned his advances for conversation. He asks her if she wants to go ice fishing and she agrees to go with him.
The screen fades to black and then displays related scenes from the same movie. The movie title is displayed: Beautiful Girls.

captions.description: A man stands on a stage holding a microphone. There are water bottles on a stool next to him, along with a cup of coffee or tea and some folded papers.
The audience laughs at the man's joke.
The man continues his story.
The audience laughs again.

scenes.description: A traffic accident has caused a traffic jam on a rural road. Police are directing traffic, and a distraught woman is trying to find out where the victim of the accident has been taken.
The distraught woman, Sharon Stone, has arrived at the hospital, where she awaits news about the accident victim.
Surgeons are in the operating room working on a patient. The patient’s wife, Stone, is seen pacing outside of the surgery room.

Richard Gere’s character is in the ocean, swimming towards a sailboat in the distance. Stone swims up next to him to let him know that their daughter had not mailed the letter that she was supposed to have mailed.
Gere’s character dives under the water and swims towards the bottom.
The video lists related video clips, according to actor, genre, mood and setting.

captions.caption: Motion Picture Association of America green screen text.
A man asks his co-worker how much he owes him.
E One logo
A man tells another he is 45 minutes late.
Two men put on hairnets.
A man gives a woman flowers and she tells him she's pregnant.
The couple is at an ultrasound and he says it's the best thing that's ever happened to him. A doctor tells him he's incapable of raising a child.
The man says he wants order in his life as children climb all over another man.
He tells his child's mother he'll prove he's worthy to be the father.
They talk at the park.
The man turns around after hearing someone enter.
A lawyer addresses the man and says he is David Wozniak.
The lawyer tells David that between 1988 and 1990, he donated sperm under the alias of Starbucks.
The lawyer says David donated 693 times, and is the father of 533 children.
David is shocked.
David says they want to know Starbuck's identity.
David's friend hands him the profiles of 142 of his children.
David eats breakfast.
David and his friend are in a yard. His friend says he looked at one profile and hands it to David.
A soccer player is on the field and there are fans in the stands.
David is at his desk with the profile folder.
A young man talks to David.
David is on the bus.
David's friend, who is also his lawyer, tells him to stop going to see his children.
David posts the children's profiles.
Montage of the children.
David says hi to someone and another man says yum-yum. David tells him not to say that.
A group of people poses for a photo.

David and Valerie walk together with arms around each other.
A man dives into a pool and David flips through newspapers at a store.
Headline reads Who's Your Daddy? and David eats.
A man with a mic speaks to a crowd of people with cameras.
David stands outside a gated area.
David's friend tells him not to reveal who he is.
David walks through a seated crowd asking what a normal person would do in this situation.
David's dad tells him a normal person wouldn't be in this situation.
David sits on the floor and looks at the profiles.
A crowd of people gather for an outdoor party.
David plays soccer in the rain at night.
A school bus drives by David on the street.
David plays soccer.
David and Valerie look at dolls.
Valerie asks David what he thinks and he says Starbuck is a pervert.
Image of a label on a donor specimen from Starbuck.
David and Valerie are in a store. The cashier asks if he can help them and Valerie asks if they have a stroller for 533 children.
Large crowd of people huddle in a circle. Text reads, "Coming Soon".

The man from the bathroom shoots the other two men sitting at the table.
He also shoots another man sitting across the restaurant at a different table.
People in the restaurant scream and run, diving under tables to get away from the shooter.

A black Trans Am comes into view approaching a roadblock.
The Trans Am slows down, but it starts to go around the police cars.
The Trans Am goes off road and overtakes the roadblock. The police officers get back into their cars.
The Trans Am continues off-road and away from the first roadblock.
The police cars chase after the Trans Am.
Inside the lead police car, Sheriff Buford T. Justice and his deputy, Junior, are driving.
More police cars continue to chase after the Trans Am.
Bo "Bandit" Darville and Carrie in the Trans Am continue driving on a dirt road.
The police cars continue chasing after the Trans Am.
The Trans Am is kicking up lots of dust and dirt.
The police cars continue kicking up dust in the Trans Am’s trail.
Sheriff Buford T. Justice tells one of his deputies to pass the Bandit's car.
Bo "Bandit" Darville continues driving the Trans Am.
The police cars try to keep up with the Trans Am.
Sheriff Branford and Cledus "Snowman" Snow drive together and talk about passing the Bandit’s car.
Sheriff Branford tells Cledus "Snowman" Snow not to wreck his car.
The Mulbery Bridge comes into view. It is a dilapidated, wooden bridge.
Bo "Bandit" Darville drives toward the Mulbery Bridge.
A road sign comes into view and states, “BRIDGE OUT”.
Bo "Bandit" Darville’s foot slams down on the gas and speeds toward the bridge.
Carrie tells Bo "Bandit" Darville that the bridge is out.
The Trans Am jumps the bridge and Carrie tells Bo "Bandit" Darville there’s water after it.
Bo "Bandit" Darville looks ahead of them at the Mulbery Bridge.
The Trans Am jumps over the gap in the Mulbery Bridge.
Carrie cheers and tells Bo "Bandit" Darville they made it.
One of the police cars follows the Trans Am and successfully makes it over the gap.
Another police car follows the first and also successfully makes it over the gap.
One of the last police cars follows the others but ends up falling into the river.
Carrie suggests they go over something else and they both celebrate.
Another police car tips over and falls into the river.
Sheriff Branford tries to figure out why they jumped over the gap, even after stopping.
Sheriff Branford figures they must have misunderstood his radio instructions.
The movie’s credits come into view.

set_timecodes.caption: The coach yells at player #45, Marty.
The coach tells Marty that all he needs to do is run out the clock.
The team suggests that Jake get the ball to Marty instead.
Jake tells Marty to go for it, but he just wants to take a knee.
Jake tells Marty that you can’t go through life being scared.
The team gets ready to start.
Marty moves from the left side to the right.
Marty sings as he sets himself up to throw the football.
Marty throws the ball in the air.
The ball flies through the air.
Marty catches the ball.
Marty yells in excitement.
The other team collapses from the force of Marty’s football throw.
The end.

The man turns toward the woman to address her.
Another shot of Venus and the cherub.

The man recites a line from Shakespeare's Macbeth.

“…BEGIN WITH A SINGLE STEP”

A line of men in military uniforms are performing jumping jacks.
The group of men stand in attention as a man on a white horse rides through.
Two men in colorful sweaters and plaid pants walk near the field and watch the soldiers.
The man on the horse stops in front of the first three men in line.
The man on the horse salutes and another soldier salutes back.
The two colorful men carry golf clubs and talk about the man on the horse.
The man on the horse asks for his mount to be held while he goes to speak to one of the men in line.
The two colorful men are now near the fence talking about the man on the horse.
The man on the horse approaches the first man in line.
The two colorful men keep discussing the man on the horse.
The man on the horse scolds the first man in line.
The man on the horse asks questions to the first man in line.
One of the colorful men hits a golf ball and it flies towards the soldiers.
The golf ball breaks through a window and lands on a man’s desk, a man stands by a vat of soup stirring it.
The man on the horse asks the soldier what fraternity he’s from.
The other colorful man tries hitting a golf ball.
The golf ball breaks through the window and lands on the same desk.
The man on the horse scolds the first man in line and tells him to go to the stable.
The colorful men are seen again, discussing their golf game.
The man on the horse addresses the whole line of men.
The horse rears onto its hind legs and throws its rider.
The colorful man near the fence hits another golf ball.
The horse rears again, but the rider is able to quickly regain control.
The colorful men keep golfing.
The horse rears again and the rider is thrown, landing on the ground.
The two colorful men discuss their game.

set_timecodes.caption: A young woman argues with an older woman. The older woman accuses the young woman of cheating. Behind her, a small dog lays on the floor.
Another young woman pulls a young man away from the scene.
The young woman asks the older woman what will happen to her. The dog lays on the floor.
The older woman replies it will be scandalous. The young woman says she is innocent. The older woman calls it moving and says even the innocent burn at the stake.
The young man peeks through the crack of a doorway. The older woman continues to tell the younger woman to leave. The young man comes out into the room, saying that he stole the exam.
The older woman scoffs, saying that the young man’s role doesn’t suit him and that he and the young woman should leave.
The young man insults the older woman, and she orders him and the other two to get out. The young woman denies cheating, the other one agreeing.
The older woman continues to shout. The young man holds up a crossbow and orders the older woman to put the phone down. She complies.
The young man says the older woman needs to learn a lesson. Both women plead with him to put the weapon down.
The young man threatens to attack the older woman until she agrees to a few things. She refuses and turns away. The dog, standing now, barks.
The young woman again tells the young man to put the weapon down, but he grabs the older woman. The dog runs away from the scene.
The young man throws the older woman over the back of the couch. The other young woman tries to stop him. The dog barks.

The second young woman knocks the crossbow from the young man's hands, aiming it at him and shooting. He is knocked back, hitting a stereo stand. The older woman tumbles down toward the floor. A movie poster advertising the title is shown, along with suggested other clips and a subscribe button.

timecodes.caption: A Japanese businessman talks to a female colleague in a hallway.
The businessman asks John, his new assistant, where the men's room is.
John misinterprets his words as a greeting.
The businessman rephrases his request, adding more emotion to his voice.
John misinterprets it as a compliment to the company.
The businessman becomes more frustrated and agitated.
John once again misunderstands the true meaning of the businessman's words.
John's misinterpretation continues.
The Japanese businessman gives John the middle finger.
John thinks the businessman is giving him a compliment.
The businessman gives the same gesture to the other coworkers as he storms away.
Credits roll, showcasing other clips and information about the film.

captions.caption: Three men in a Jurassic Park-themed jeep pull up to the dinosaur enclosure.
One of the men takes off his sunglasses and stares in awe at what he sees.
The woman in the second jeep points out that the species of dinosaur in front of them has been extinct since the Cretaceous period.
The group gets out of their jeeps to examine the large dinosaur in front of them.
John Hammond, the park’s creator, walks over to greet the group.
The men in the first jeep acknowledge what they've seen and congratulate John Hammond.
Dr. Grant tells John Hammond that his book is completely wrong about the dinosaur.
The dinosaur leans over to grab leaves from a nearby tree.
Donald Gennaro, a lawyer representing the investors, notes that the park will make them a fortune.
Dr. Grant asks John Hammond how fast the T-Rex is.
Dr. Sattler asks if Hammond has a T-Rex, to which he replies, “Say again?”. Dr. Grant explains they do have a T-Rex.
John Hammond welcomes the group to Jurassic Park.
Dr. Grant looks on in wonder.
The group walks over to see more dinosaurs, including a herd of Parasaurolophus.
Dr. Sattler is amazed by the group of dinosaurs.
Dr. Grant notes that the dinosaurs are moving in herds.
John Hammond asks the group what they think.
Dr. Grant asks John Hammond how he did all this.
John Hammond tells Dr. Grant that he will show him.
Universal Pictures logo
A helicopter descends toward a tropical island.
A glowing piece of amber is showcased in a dark room.
A helicopter lands near a waterfall, and John Hammond walks into a building.
The word “Remember” appears in white.

Lex Murphey eats a bowl of jello.
Dr. Grant smashes through a window.

A lion walks through the forest, then the view changes to a sunset over a cliff.
Chuckie stands at the edge of a cliff with monkeys behind him. He throws a jar of peanut butter off the cliff.
The jar falls down a waterfall. The monkeys look over the edge of the cliff at the falling jar.
Chuckie looks down, covered in peanut butter. The view quickly changes to multiple shots of the monkeys looking angry.
The monkeys attack Chuckie.
Tommy arrives riding Spike, who licks Chuckie.
Tommy invites Chuckie onto Spike's back, then both Tommy and Chuckie hold a cookie each.

A woman in a black jacket fights multiple people in an alley.
A close-up of a man's face with a mustache as he speaks.
A blue-skinned man with glowing white eyes is shown from the neck up wearing a suit and tie.
The woman from the alley fights a man, whips her hair, and hits the man on the neck with the handle of a hammer.
A man in a studded black jacket points a pistol, and the woman shoots him.
The blue-skinned man in the suit and tie appears again.
The blue-skinned man is shown on television at what appears to be a press conference. A crowd watches him on the screens as well as in person.
The woman from earlier is back in the alley fighting more men. One of the men she fights has his hair in cornrows and she holds him by the neck in front of her before flinging him to the ground.
The man with the mustache appears again.
The blue-skinned man appears again.
The man with the mustache appears again.
A man wearing a green jacket appears on television on the screens at the press conference.
The man with the mustache appears again.
The blue-skinned man appears again.
The audience members begin to exit the building. A woman with short dark hair in a black dress with white collar is shown with a man standing behind her.
A man with a maroon shirt, a man in a suit with a gray tie, and a man in a suit with a yellow tie watch the press conference.
The woman with short dark hair and white collar is shown walking out of the building with the same man following her. The image is captured on the press conference television screens.
The blue-skinned man is shown seated at the press conference.
The woman with short dark hair is shown walking out of the building.
The woman with short dark hair speaks and her words can be heard playing back from the television screens at the press conference.
The same three suited men from before watch the press conference with concern.
The woman with short dark hair is shown speaking on the television screens at the press conference.
The blue-skinned man appears again.
The woman with short dark hair is shown as she walks down the steps inside the building with a group of others around her.
The woman with short dark hair continues her speech as she becomes distraught.
She finishes speaking as she begins to cry. Another woman comes over to comfort her and they hug. This is all shown on the television screen at the press conference.
The blue-skinned man is shown at the press conference. He speaks to the camera before being shown again on the television screen in which he looks out over a crowd of press members.
The woman with short dark hair and the woman hugging her are shown crying as they continue speaking.
The blue-skinned man appears at the press conference.
The woman with short dark hair is shown crying while another woman comforts her.
The audience members begin leaving the building.
The press conference grows chaotic and members of the crowd start yelling and screaming. The blue-skinned man appears again and glows brightly, yelling while seeming to disintegrate.
The screen goes white.
The building is shown as the camera pans out and over a table. The blue-skinned man reappears on the stage of the press conference.
The scene opens with a woman being interviewed for a secretarial position.
The interviewer reclines back on the couch as he explains that the interviewee is overqualified.
The interviewee explains that she wants to be bored.
The interviewer explains that he needs a typist who can be on time and answer the phone.
The interviewee states that she can do that.
The interviewer tells the interviewee that it is very dull work.
The interviewee replies that she likes dull work.
The interviewer begins to speak.
The interviewee agrees with something the interviewer has said.
The interviewer asks a question.
The interviewee does not know.
The interviewer says that he is not there and picks up the phone and offers it to the interviewee.
The interviewer tells her to use sugar in her coffee.

Marilyn Monroe and Thelma Ritter are sitting at a diner. Eli Wallach and Clark Gable are sitting a few seats down from them at the diner.
Eli Wallach and Clark Gable share a lighthearted conversation.
A waitress sets down their drink order.

Thelma Ritter comments.

Marilyn Monroe asks a follow-up question.
Clark Gable explains how to live. Marilyn Monroe explains her feelings and shares her experience with an empty house.
Clark Gable offers Marilyn Monroe the empty house. Marilyn Monroe confirms that the previous person living in the house is gone.
Clark Gable confirms that the previous tenant is gone. Marilyn Monroe explains that she'd prefer to rent a car.
Eli Wallach offers up his car and states that his friend Gay has a truck. Thelma Ritter says she’d like to be on her own. Clark Gable offers to let her rent a car from his business.
Marilyn Monroe and Thelma Ritter discuss the offer.
Thelma Ritter and Marilyn Monroe continue their conversation. Eli Wallach and Clark Gable begin to leave the diner.
A slideshow of related videos for *The Misfits* plays, highlighting the movie poster and various clips.

Names and roles of several crew members from *The Misfits* are displayed, including actor Clark Gable, actor Eli Wallach, and director John Huston. Video clips showing each person play while their role is displayed.
The movie genre, Classics, and popular genres within Best of the Best, Action, and Jerks are displayed.
The setting of the film, Diner, the character type, Cowboy, and the popular occasion, First Date, are shown.
The options Hot New Trailers, Film News, and Exclusive Mashups Parodies are displayed.
The MovieClips logo displays.

A line of men in suits and sunglasses walk in formation
The young boy tries to ask the girl in the pink dress to dance
The boy pulls out a level two clearance badge and the suited men back away
The boy asks again if she wants to dance
The girl agrees to dance ballet
The boy begins dancing ballet and spinning on the floor
The girl begins to dance and spin on the floor
The boy lifts the girl and continues dancing ballet
A man at a podium attempts to begin an announcement
The girl must leave and the suited men close in

The boy takes his jacket off and heads toward his table

captions.caption: Will Smith shoots his gun from the hood of a car and chases people into a building.
Will Smith runs into a building with his gun drawn.
Will Smith runs through the building with his gun drawn, following the people he was chasing outside.
Will Smith runs upstairs in the building with his gun drawn, following the people he was chasing outside.
Will Smith runs along a terrace with his gun drawn, following the people he was chasing outside.

Will Smith jumps out of a window and hides behind a dumpster. He pulls his gun back out, and runs into a hair salon, where he slides across the floor and hides between patrons getting their hair done.
Will Smith enters a different building and kicks a door open with his gun drawn. He looks out the door at a group of men in wheelchairs. One man shoots at him from a taxi cab.
Will Smith and Martin Lawrence duck for cover as the man in the taxi shoots at them.
Will Smith runs up to the taxi and shoots into it.
Will Smith jumps over the taxi, then onto the top of a passing car, then onto the roof of the taxi, where he is attacked by Martin Lawrence.
The taxi turns a corner and hits a shopping cart. The taxi cab then hits a car. Will Smith jumps from the roof of the taxi cab onto the street as the taxi drives away.
Will Smith runs after the taxi, then falls to the street. Martin Lawrence gets out of the taxi and runs toward him. Will Smith shoots into the taxi.

Martin Lawrence falls to the street with Will Smith. The taxi pulls away. Will Smith and Martin Lawrence look toward the car. Martin Lawrence says "Don't never say I wasn't there for you." The taxi drives away into the sunset.
